short_term: Will likely seek academic support such as tutoring or study groups to improve grades and manage coursework.
May explore different study techniques and time management strategies to cope with academic pressures.
long_term: Expected to develop better academic habits, potentially leading to improved academic performance and consideration for internships or part-time jobs related to field of study.
Could experience a shift in major or career interests as a result of gaining more clarity on personal and professional goals.

short_term: Will attempt to foster new friendships at college while maintaining communication with old friends through social media or planned visits.
Might engage in campus activities or clubs to expand social network and combat feelings of loneliness.
long_term: Establishing a more stable social circle within the college community, potentially leading to lifelong friendships.
Increased independence could lead to significant personal growth and changes in relationships with family and childhood friends.

short_term: Will likely seek out counseling services or support groups on campus to address mood swings and existential crises.
Might start practicing mindfulness or other stress-reduction techniques to cope with the pressures of college life.
long_term: Expected to develop a more resilient mental framework, potentially through therapy, self-care routines, or personal growth initiatives.
There might be a shift towards a more balanced lifestyle with improved health habits as the individual matures and learns to manage stress better.

short_term: Will begin to budget more carefully, potentially seeking part-time work or applying for financial aid to alleviate financial strain.
May start to look for cost-saving measures like shared housing or cheaper meal plans.
long_term: Could see an improvement in financial management skills, possibly leading to better financial independence and less reliance on loans.
Might start to consider future financial planning like saving for graduate school, investing, or planning for financial stability post-graduation.

short_term: Will continue to reflect on personal values and the purpose of education, potentially leading to a reassessment of current academic path.
Might engage in discussions or join groups that explore philosophical and ethical issues.
long_term: Expected to develop a clearer sense of personal identity and values, influencing career choices and life philosophy.
Could start to integrate philosophical insights into daily life, leading to a more meaningful and authentic existence.

short_term: Will focus on improving coding skills through online courses or coding bootcamps to meet academic requirements.
Might start to use technology more effectively for academic purposes, like project management tools or educational apps.
long_term: Expected to become more proficient in technology, potentially integrating it into career plans or personal projects.
Will likely adapt to the rapid changes in technology, using it to enhance both professional and personal life.
